crisis." Rep. Mike Pence earned his biggest applause when he declared, " We Trust will not restore this nation with public policy alone; it will require public virtue." And former Rick Santorum had this to say: The idea that the basic moral values of our country are not part of an integrated set of issues that keep our country safe and prosperous is a very dangerous idea. Obviously, the Values Voter Conference was a place to talk about "values," but it stands out because each speaker explicitly connected values talk to the Tea Party and the conservative resurgence.
